document.docAuthor: Frolov, Andrey V. & Akhmetova, Lilia A.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Orphninae (Coleoptera: Scarabaeidae) of Sri Lanka, with description of a new species of genus Orphnus Macleay, 1819

figureCitation.captionText: Fig. 5. Orphnus parvus (Wiedemann, 1823). A–C. Lectotype, ♂ (ZMUKK). D–H. Lectotype of Orphnus nanus Westwood, 1845, ♂ (ZMUKK). I. ♀ (MNHN). A–B, H–I. Habitus in dorsal view. C, E. Labels. D. Endophallus. F. Aedeagus in lateral view. G. Parameres in dorsal view. J. Distributional record map. Scale bars: A–B, H–I = 1.0 mm; D, F–G = 0.5 mm.

caption.paragraph:
Fig. 4.
Orphnus bicolor ( Fabricius, 1801 )
. A–F . Lectotype, ♂ (ZMUKG). G–H . ♀ (MNHN). A–B , G–H . Habitus in dorsal view. C . Labels. D . Endophallus. E . Aedeagus in lateral view. F . Parameres in dorsal view. I . Distributional record map. Scale bars: A–B, G–H = 1.0 mm; D–F = 0.5 mm.

Fig. 5.
Orphnus parvus ( Wiedemann, 1823 )
. A–C . Lectotype, ♂ (ZMUKK). D–H . Lectotype of
Orphnus nanus Westwood, 1845
, ♂ (ZMUKK). I . ♀ (MNHN). A–B, H–I . Habitus in dorsal view. C , E . Labels. D . Endophallus. F . Aedeagus in lateral view. G . Parameres in dorsal view. J . Distributional record map. Scale bars: A–B, H–I = 1.0 mm; D, F–G = 0.5 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Orphnus parvus
is similar to
O. bicolor
in having the pronotum without a tubercle on base medially and endophallus with a few groups of spinules. It differs from the latter in having the parameres in dorsal view without notches basad of lateral teeth ( Fig. 5G ), shorter parameres (about 0.5 length of phallobase [ Fig. 5E ] as opposed to 0.7 length of phallobase in
O. bicolor
[ Fig. 4E ]), and abdominal sternite 8 medially as long as sternites 4–7 combined (as opposed to sternite 8 medially distinctly longer than sternites 4–7 combined in
O. bicolor
).

Lectotype

.

INDIA • 1♂ ;“ TYPE COL: 482 2/2
Orphnus nanus Westw.
HOPE DEPT.OXFORD / TYPE WESTWOOD Trans. Ent. Soc. 4.1846.P.177 Coll. Hope Oxon. / Prof. Westwood’s private collection purchased from Miss Swann 1895 Collected by

/ [9…H] /
Orphnus nanus Westw
”; ZMUKK
.
Body length of the examined specimens varies from 6.1 to 8.2 mm (males) and 6.0 to 7.5 mm (females).
